channel.title: CVE Feed for silverstripe -- silverstripe-framework
channel.description: The latest CVEs for silverstripe -- silverstripe-framework

item.title: CVE-2023-22729|2024-08-02T10:13:50.178Z -- silverstripe -- silverstripe-framework
item.description: Silverstripe Framework is the Model-View-Controller framework that powers the Silverstripe content management system. Prior to version 4.12.15, an attacker can display a link to a third party website on a login screen by convincing a legitimate content author to follow a specially crafted link. Users should upgrade to Silverstripe Framework 4.12.15 or above to address the issue.

item.title: CVE-2023-22728|2024-08-02T10:13:50.222Z -- silverstripe -- silverstripe-framework
item.description: Silverstripe Framework is the Model-View-Controller framework that powers the Silverstripe content management system. Prior to version 4.12.15, the GridField print view incorrectly validates the permission of DataObjects potentially allowing a content author to view records they are not authorised to access. Users should upgrade to Silverstripe Framework 4.12.15 or above to address the issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-32981|2024-07-18T13:18:50.890Z -- silverstripe -- silverstripe-framework
item.description: Silverstripe framework is the PHP framework forming the base for the Silverstripe CMS. In affected versions a bad actor with access to edit content in the CMS could add send a specifically crafted encoded payload to the server, which could be used to inject a JavaScript payload on the front end of the site. The payload would be sanitised on the client-side, but server-side sanitisation doesn't catch it. The server-side sanitisation logic has been updated to sanitise against this type of attack in version 5.2.16. All users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2024-32981|2024-07-17T19:36:00.563Z -- silverstripe -- silverstripe-framework
